title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Entered the interview process and was quite easy and straightforward. Was a easy process throughout and the atmosphere felt like it would be nice to join the organisation. I would recommend applying to this organisation.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 1 year time

title: BD Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was an hour-long interview. Overall it was pretty smooth. I tried to be confident and relaxed when answering the questions. They also asked behavioural questions such as 'described a time when you handles a challenging situation'
Interview Questions:
1. Sell me this umbrella/ pen
2. Pick something that is the least useful in this room and then sell it to me

title: Team Leader Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite casual but maintained an air of formality. The questions asked were mainly about gauging your personality and how that would fit in with the social brand. Overall, it felt like they wanted to ensure that their members had commitment and good values.
Interview Questions: What is one time that you failed and how did you overcome it?

title: Business Development Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Melbourne) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
There are 3 rounds, if you pass one, you get an email inviting you to the next round. I got to individual interview but got declined. They generously scheduled a session to give overall feedback, but it was quite general.
Round 1: Online Application - fill out google forms
Round 2: Assessment Centre - work with a team on a general task
Round 3: Individual Interview - basic get-to-know personality interview
Interview Questions:
Assessment Centre: work with a team to develop a product/initiative that aligned with a SDG and pitch with another team

Individual Interview:
- what do you know about AIESEC?
- reflect on your AC experience: what your role was, how you could handle it better etc
- a few basic situational questions
- what do you know about [the department you're applying for]?
- can you commit at least 10 hours a week?

title: Local Committee President Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
Write a platform. Challenges, and election.
Platforms contain lots of questions, have to format carefully. 
Challenges are done in videos and ways that requires reaching out to alumni.
Inspiring, motivational public speaking style are important for your speech in election for the votes.
Interview Questions: Describe a 5 years road map for your entity

title: Team Member, Outgoing Exchange Program (OGX) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Sydney) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
fairly straightforward and quick process. all up, took about a week and a half to get through. the process was:

1. online application 
2. invitation to group assessment
3. individual interview with two panelists
Interview Questions: How would you describe internet to your grandmother?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Melbourne)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly brief, with three sections. They were mostly about my strengths and weaknesses. The interviewers were super helpful and understanding if I needed some time to think.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you didn't meet a goal.

title: Finance and Governance Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: They have a group interview, then an individual interview. The group interview is just playing some games like building a tower using spaghetti and marshmallow, thinking of a world problem then present it as a group. Individual questions are mostly behavior questions. It lasts for around 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Member Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions:
Basic interview - competency and behavioural questions. 
Prepare for basic interview questions (e.g. strengths/weaknesses, your background, what exp you had etc) 
Be yourself, understand the values of the organisation and incorporate it into your interview and assessment centre
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this position?
Tell me a time when you experienced criticism, how did you respond?

title: Outgoing Exchange Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Melbourne) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was an online application form where you detailed your reason for joining and preferred choice of department.  Followed by an assessment centre in a group, then finally individual interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time where you did not achieve your goal? What did you do?
